subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Photosynthesis is the process through which green plants produce their own food using sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water.
points: Light energy is converted into chemical energy.
Essential for plant growth and oxygen production.

subsections.title: Process Summary
subsections.content: The main products of photosynthesis are glucose and oxygen.
points: 6CO₂ + 6H₂O → C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂ (in the presence of light and chlorophyll).
Takes place in the palisade cells of leaves.
Water is absorbed by roots; carbon dioxide enters through stomata.

subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Respiration is the breakdown of food molecules to release energy for cellular processes.
points: Takes place in all living cells.
Energy released is stored in ATP (adenosine triphosphate).

subsections.title: Types of Respiration
subsections.content: Respiration can be aerobic or anaerobic.
points: Aerobic: requires oxygen and produces more ATP.
Anaerobic: occurs without oxygen, less efficient.
Anaerobic in muscles produces lactic acid.

subsections.title: Importance of Respiration
subsections.content: Energy released is used for various biological functions.
